Shillong boy drowns at Kempty falls.description: MUSSOORIE: A student of Tibetan Homes Foundation (THF) school at Mussoorie died after drowning in Kempty Fall on Sunday. According to ML Jakhmola, station officer at Kempty police station, a group of around 20 students of THF along with some teachers had gone on a trek to Kempty Fall on Sunday when the incident took place. He said, “They had reportedly gone via a trek route which led them to a point above the main road at the Kempty fall where the student Tensin Choing, 17, drowned.” He added that the deceased was a resident of Shillong. “The parents of the deceased have been informed and the post-mortem has been conducted,” Jakhmola said, adding that police are also looking into other evidence to rule out foul play. Even after repeated efforts, the school authorities could not be contacted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MLA, mayor continue spar over cleaning w.description: HARIDWAR: BJP leader and city MLA Madan Kaushik and Congress leader and city mayor Anita Sharma engaged in mud-slinging on Sunday as both traded charges, at separate press conferences, on the issue of cleaning workers’ strike. Kaushik, while speaking at the press conference, said, “She (Sharma) isn’t co-operating with the Nagar Nigam officials to ensure that streets of my constituency remain dirty. She deliberately took the contract of collecting and processing garbage from KRL Waste Management and gave it to a petty contractor.” Kaushik’s statement comes a day after KRL’s employees ended their strike after protesting for five days. The door-to-door garbage collection had stopped in the city on June 11 due to the strike. However, it has resumed now after Kaushik’s intervention. On the other hand, Anita Sharma alleged that Kaushik, who is also the state urban development minister, is using his post to influence Nagar Nigam officials. “A notice was served to KRL on June 13 regarding termination of its services but the minister allowed the company to continue its services without taking me into confidence. Kaushik is ensuring that the Nagar Nigam officials do not co-operate with me,” said Sharma, while speaking at a press conference. Commenting on the strike, Harendra Garg, KRL director, told TOI, “We received a 15-year contract for city’s garbage collection in 2012. Since past few months, we were receiving Rs 28 to 30 lakh per month as our tipping fee as against our expenses amounting to Rs 42 lakh per month. So, in an attempt to eliminate the revenue deficit, we raised door-to-door garbage collection charges in 20 wards of the city. This was not to the liking of certain employees.” Meanwhile, city residents heaved a sigh of relief as the KRL employees resumed the door-to-door garbage collection services. Mussoorie: Garbage collection worst hit.description: MUSSOORIE: An indefinite strike launched by workers of Mussoorie Municipal Corporation (MMC) on Monday evening threw life out of gear in the tourist town. While both barriers of Mall Road remained unmanned on the second consecutive day, garbage collection and disposal were the worst hit at the peak of the tourist season. Although the door-to-door collection of garbage has been handed over to a private agency, the cleaning of roads and picking up of garbage from Mall Road are done by civic body workers. Shalabh Garg, a local resident, said, “The Mall Road was not cleaned and brimming garbage bins caused much inconvenience.” Another resident said, “The MMC workers beat up tourists and if action is taken against them, why should they go on strike and hold the town at ransom?” MMC workers also took out a protest march on Mall Road and demanded that the station officer of Mussoorie be transferred. “We have submitted a memorandum to the sub-divisional magistrate as well as to the SSP demanding transfer of the SHO,” said Mahavir Singh Rana, president of MMC Workers’ Union. As the arrested MMC workers were given bail around Tuesday afternoon, the strike was called off later in the day after talks with police officers. The MMC workers went on strike after a fight between tourists and workers present at the entry barrier on Mall Road. Six people had been arrested after the scuffle including three tourists. Chopper service \u2018delayed\u2019, Mum.description: DEHRADUN: A 52-year-old pilgrim from Mumbai who suffered breathlessness in Kedarnath lost his life after an alleged delay on the part of a helicopter service provider to transport him to a hospital. Angry over the delay and death, the kin of the victim created a ruckus at the helipad and had heated arguments with helicopter service provider who later suspended operations for around two hours. The district administration has ordered an inquiry into the matter. Rudraprayag district magistrate Mangesh Ghildiyal told TOI that the deceased, Vinod Vyas, 52, was a resident of Goregaon in Mumbai West. “He complained of breathlessness in the temple after which he was taken to a health camp. The doctors at the health camp referred him to a bigger health centre in Guptkashi. We immediately ordered the transportation of the victim to Guptkashi but he died before he could reach the hospital,” the DM said. According to eyewitnesses, even after receiving the orders, the man remained lying on a stretcher near the helipad for over 30 minutes. The kin of the victim started heated arguments with the helicopter service provider designated by the district administration. “But the officials of the helicopter service provider didn’t pay any heed. It is only after the police intervened that they transported the man to Guptkashi where he was declared brought dead by the doctors,” said a police official from Rudraprayag on the condition of anonymity. Chief medical officer of the district,Dr SK Jha told TOI that the patient was very serious when he was examined and “we had asked for immediate referral.” The district magistrate meanwhile said that an official has been designed to conduct an inquiry. “Circle officer Kedarnath will be investigating the matter after which appropriate action will be taken,” said the district magistrate. Forest dept sends notice to Noida-based.description: HARIDWAR: In wake of the upcoming grand wedding of the children of Gupta brothers in the eco-sensitive zone of Chamoli district, the state forest department has send a notice to the Noida-based entertainment company, that is organising the wedding, seeking details of the gathering, including all clearances. The picturesque Auli, where the high-profile weddings are going to take place, houses the Nanda Devi National Park and the Valley of Flowers and the place is extremely sensitive to pollution and external interference. To ensure quick action if the bio-diversity of the area is disturbed, the forest department has also enhanced its workforce in the area. The notice reads, “As per media reports, a big gathering is anticipated in the area. Helicopters will make sorties to bring in guests and the event may leave behind a trail of garbage. There is a possibility that it would affect the wildlife and ecology of the area. And it would violate The Indian Forest Act 1926 and Wildlife Protection Act 1972.” It adds, “In case of any violation of any Act, legal action will be taken as per rules.” The notice also sought a response with all the clearances. “Share with us all the details of the land (reserved/civil/van panchayat/naap bhumi) where the event will take place along with the clearances and approval letters. Also mention how the area would be cleared off organic and inorganic waste after the event,” the notice states. Meanwhile, Chamoli DFO Kisan Chand said that they were not intimidated about the wedding. “We got to know about it from the media and have deployed extra force to deal with any problem.” Head of forest force Jai Raj said, “If something needs to be done, the department will do it. Our officers are on their toes.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rain brings respite and woes both.description: Dehradun: Heavy rain lashed Dehradun on Monday giving the much-needed respite from heat to the city residents. The city experienced pleasant weather conditions following the spell. This comes after the city recorded its hottest day of the season on Saturday with a maximum temperature of 41 degrees Celsius. However, the rainfall also brought civic woes along with it. Just almost two-and-a-half hours of downpour in the evening left several areas of the city including Rajpur Road, Survey Chowk, Subhash Road, Patel Nagar, Gandhi Road, Saharanpur Chowk, among others, waterlogged. Bindal, Rispana bridge and Garhi cantt area were the worst affected as water entered houses and shops in these areas. Traffic snarls were reported from Subhash Road, Patel Nagar, Clock Tower and Tehsil Chowk. Felling of trees was reported in in FRI, Chakrata road and Race course localities of the city. Residents claim that the rain exposed the tall claims of civic authorities. "If the city couldn't take a two-hour rain spell, what will happen during the peak monsoon? Roads were waterlogged, electricity supply was disturbed, and traffic snarls riddled the city after the rain spell," Virendra Singh Negi, a resident of Nehru Gram, told TOI. When queried about the issues, city mayor Sunil Uniyal Gama told TOI, “We haven’t received any complaint regarding water-logging but we have set up a control room where citizens can share their complaint any time.” Notably, a few days ago, an amount of Rs 50 lakh was approved for the cleaning and repair of the 17 small and big major drains of the city during the second board meeting of Dehradun Muncipal Corporation. Meanwhile, Haridwar also received rain spell and there too, the residents faced similar issues. Water logging led to traffic jams in many areas of the city after the rain spell. Pindar valley yet to emerge from shadow.description: Bageshwar: It has been six years since the devastating flash floods of 2013 which had severely impacted the Kedar valley as well as other parts of Uttarakhand. While the Kedar valley has now gradually returned to normalcy, the Pindar valley which was also affected by the flash floods, is yet to step out of the disaster’s shadow. “Before the calamity, the Pindar valley used to host an average of 6,000 tourists every year but the footfall is now limited to a few hundred tourists. This has greatly impacted the livelihood of the people in the valley,” said Pratap Singh, who runs a restaurant in Kharkiya Tok area of Vacham village in the Pindar region. The most affected is the Pindari glacier trek. Once listed amongst the easiest treks of the state prior to the disaster, the trek route now faces several challenges. Several paths have been washed away and permanent bridges have given way to temporary wooden overpasses, making the trek a dangerous one. “All the paths and bridges are in a dilapidated state. The government must ensure immediate repair works to promote tourism in the valley,” said Surendra Vishwakarma, a tourist from Delhi. Although the entire Pindari glacier trek route is in shambles since the disaster, the bridge damage at Dwali (12 km from zero point) has made the climb especially risky for tourists as the temporary bridge that has been put up here, according to observers, isn’t strong enough to sustain the river flow. When queried, SK Pandey, executive engineer, PWD, Kapkot, said, “A permanent bridge at Dwali was sanctioned post the tragedy but the project couldn’t start for want of budget. Recently, Rs 1 crore was sanctioned for the bridge and we hope that its construction will be completed by June next year.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Swami Darshan Bharti\u2019s bail plea sc.description: DEHRAUDUN: A day after a local court in Rudraprayag rejected the bail plea of Uttarakhand Raksha Abhiyan patron Swami Darshan Bharti, the organization, on Tuesday, threatened a state-wide agitation. Bharti is accused of uploading a social media post provoking communal disharmony over a case in which a girl was harassed by a youth of another community in Agastmuni in April 2018. Bharti’s post allegedly led to torching and looting of the establishments belonging to the people from accused’s community. The decision, however, did not go down well with Bharti’s supporters and members of the Uttarakhand Raksha Abhiyan who have threatened an agitation accusing the state and the central government of acting against the ‘foot soldiers of Hindutva’. Harikrishan Kimoti, convenor, Uttarakhan Raksha Abhiyan told TOI that the group has circulated over 1.5 lakh pamphlets, a copy of which is with TOI, exhorting the majority to stand up against minorities whose population has skyrocketed in the state. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Monsoon weeks away, DMC yet to desilt Ri.description: DEHRADUN: With the monsoon less than two weeks away, the Dehradun Municipal Corporation’s plan to desilt Rispana and Bindal rivers is yet to take off. The cleaning drive, which was to start late last month, is yet to make any significant progress, even though pre-monsoon rains have already hit the state. Mayor Sunil Uniyal Gama had announced last month that silt in the rivers will be cleared before the onset of monsoon, to ensure smooth flow of rainwater. Gama had also said that an amount of Rs 50 lakh will be disbursed by DMC for the purpose and had held a meeting with district magistrate and MDDA vice-president about it. While some DMC officials said the cleaning process had started only a few days back and was unlikely to be finished before monsoon, others said it hadn’t started in earnest yet. DMC health officer RK Singh said, “We have started cleaning the rivers. In fact, just a few days back, we held a drive near Kargi Chowk. We aim to finish the cleaning as soon as possible.” Another senior official, who didn’t wish to be named, said, “Though the announcement was made last month, we are yet to start desilting the rivers. We need to issue tenders for the purpose, which hasn’t started yet.” Residents said the silt in the river has caused the riverbed to rise. “The river has not been cleaned properly for years, which caused silt to deposit on the riverbed. It has risen over the years, and now the river overflows easily and water enters low-lying areas, creating a flood-like situation,” said Rajkumar Tiwari, a resident of Kanwli Road. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Six arrested in Rs 33 Lakh petrol pump r.description: ROORKEE: Manglaur police on Tuesday arrested six persons in connection with robbery at a local petrol pump on NH-58 on June 10. One of the accused turned out to be an employee of the petrol pump. Two employees of the petrol pump, who were on their way to deposit Rs 33 lakh in a bank in Roorkee, were robbed of the cash on their way there. The accused held the victims at gunpoint and snatched the money after throwing chilli powder in their eyes. The accused were identified as Rakesh Pal, 35, Jitender, 27, Veer Singh, 27, Ramvir Singh, 25, Sunil Kumar Sonu, 30 and Anuj Kumar, 24. While the first four persons are from Milap Nagar locality the remaining duo are residents of Mohanpura locality. Veer Singh and Ramvir Singh are siblings. Anuj was an employee of the filling station. On June 10, Amir Ahmed and Pawan Chauhan, both employees of Reliance petrol pump, were on their way to deposit Rs 33,56,000 cash in a bank when their bike was intercepted by the accused around 12 pm. The miscreants, who were on two bikes, brandished a gun and threw chilli powder at the petrol pump employees before fleeing with the loot. According to Haridwar SSP Janmaijai Prabhakar Khanduri, Rakesh Pal, a gang leader, along with Jitendra and Veer Singh, hatched the plan to rob the petrol pump last month. Police have recovered Rs 23,05,000 from the accused. They said efforts were on to recover the rest of the amount from the accused. Lalit Mohan Agarwal, owner of petrol pump, said, “Manglaur police, led by inspector Pradeep Chauhan and special operation group (SOG) team have done a remarkable job in quickly solving the case.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chopper service 'delayed', Mumbai man di.description: DEHRADUN: A 52-year-old pilgrim from Mumbai who suffered breathlessness in Kedarnath lost his life allegedly after the helicopter took 45 minutes to take him to hospital. Angry over the delay and death, the kin of the victim created ruckus at the helipad and had heated arguments with helicopter service providers who later went on strike for around two hours. The district administration has ordered inquiry into the matter. Rudraprayag district magistrate Mangesh Ghildiyal told TOI that the deceased, Vinod Vyas, 52, was a resident of Goregaon in Mumbai West. “He complained of breathlessness in the temple after which he was taken to a health camp. The doctors at the health camp referred him to a bigger health centre in Guptakashi. We immediately ordered the transportation of the victim to Guptakashi but he died before he could have reached to the hospital,” the DM said. According to the eyewitnesses, even after receiving the orders, the man remained lying on a stretcher near the helipad for over 30 minutes. The kin of the victim started heated arguments with the helicopter service provider designated by the district administration. “But the officials of the helicopter service providers didn’t pay any heed. It is only after the police intervened that they transported the elderly man to Guptakshi where he was declared brought dead by the doctors,” said a cop from Rudraprayag on the condition of anonymity. Chief medical officer Dr SK Jha said that it was a delay of around 30 minutes in the transportation of the elderly man. “He was very serious and we had asked for immediate referral,” he added. The district administration as well as police department have ordered an inquiry into the matter. “Circle Officer Kedarnath will be investigating the matter after which appropriate action will be taken,” said the DM, who added that the helicopter service providers went on a strike for around two hours in Kedarnath after the heated arguments between the kin of the victim, police and their workers. Now, plant a sapling in memory of a love.description: Haridwar: Now, pilgrims visiting Uttarakhand can plant a sapling in memory of their loved one and also see the tree grow using a mobile app. The state forest department has also earmarked for the project specified forest areas which are being developed as ‘Smriti Van’ (Forest of memories). The initiative was kickstarted at Haridwar on Sunday by Garhwal commissioner Basava Purushottam. Foundation stones were also laid for the project at Digoli van panchayat in Chamoli, Batola on the Rishikesh-Badrinath national highway, Rishikesh-Haridwar bypass in Dehradun, horticulture farm in Uttarkashi and Ratura in Rudraprayag. Speaking to TOI, Purushottam said that local villagers are being taken into the loop to ensure that the saplings are cared for properly.“The self-help groups of the respective Ganga grams (villages located along river Ganga) and van panchayats would ensure that the planted saplings are guarded well and their maintenance, watering and online updating of latest pictures in the app is done in a timely manner.” he added. Terming the initiative as “a unique way in which people can pay homage to their ancestors and deceased loved ones”, tourism minister Satpal Maharaj said, “Uttarakhand is Dev Boomi and people come here for spiritual salvation. Smriti Van will be one more opportunity and a unique way to pay tribute to departed souls.” He added that he has also shared a plan with the state government to make a separate 'Smriti Van' at Kedarnath in the memory of the 2013 disaster victims. In Haridwar, the Ganga Vatika in Kankhal and Khadkadi area have been chosen for creating the ‘Forest of memories’. Speaking to TOI, district magistrate of Haridwar Deepak Rawat said that “cremation committees are being asked to promote the environment-friendly cause by motivating those who visit Haridwar for cremation and related activities.” Incidentally, each sapling would be geo-tagged and its geo-location would be shared with the person planting the sapling. “Each sapling will have a ‘special identity’ so that its owner doesn’t get confused. A unique bar code will be issued at the time of planting that would also be tagged with the plant and every week, the picture of the plant would be uploaded in the app for the users to see,” said Purushotam. While a fee of Rs 2,000 is being charged for every sapling in Haridwar, the price of the saplings and their maintenance charges would vary from district to district. (with inputs by Ishita Mishra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Green Card.description: NEW DELHI: In an attempt to strike a balance between those standing in queue for decades for employment-based green cards (owing to the per country caps) and the need to protect American workers, a bill - 'The Fairness for High Skilled Immigrants Act (S.386)', has been recently amended by Republican Senator Mike Lee. The amendments are being seen as a bid to facilitate its passage. To provide more protection to American workers, it requires that the employer sponsoring H-1B workers must disclose online (for at least 30 days) various details of the job on offer, such as occupation or job position, education and experience requirements, location and also how to apply for this job. A filing fee is also sought to be introduced forLabour Condition Applications(LCA), which is an attestation-based requirement that has to be met by sponsoring employers prior to filing of H-1B visa applications. This bill was originally introduced in the US Senate on February 7. It sought to remove the per country cap on employment-based green cards and shorten the wait time for the vast majority of applications in the backlog. US issues 1.40 lakh employment-based green cards annually. Substantial increase in denial of H-1B petitions of Indians: ReportHowever, not more than 7% can go to nationals of any one country. With a high influx of the Indian diaspora in the US, it has resulted in a heavy backlog, with those in the EB-2 category (having advanced degrees) having to face a wait time of 151 years. "Over the last decade, various bills to remove this per country cap, have failed to become law. S. 386 has been rescued from the fate of its predecessors through appeasement, specifically, by agreeing to amendments that would allow further restrictions on merit-based non-immigrant visas, particularly with regards to the H-1B programme. However, it is interesting to note that many of these so-called 'new' restrictions already exist in one form or another," Florida based immigration attorney, Ashwin Sharma, told TOI. For instance, even currently,   H-1B sponsoring employers have to certify   that they are not favouring immigrant workers over American workers. They have to indicate how they calculated the prevailing wages they are offering to H-1B workers (but these records are to be made available only on specific request of the concerned authorities), explained Sharma. While the bill would alleviate the green card backlog and significantly benefit India, followed by China, it also seeks to ensure that the green card for others is not delayed beyond the time it would have otherwise taken, had this bill not been passed. Another similar bill HR 1044, introduced by the Democrats is pending in the US House. 'Immigration Voice', a US based non-profit which is engaged in alleviating problems faced by legal highly-skilled immigrants, in its social media post on June 17, said that it has reached a deal with Senator Lee and the amendments will enable the bill to pass. "We have a deal to break the deadlock in the Senate!," it posted on Twitter. A note, issued by it analysing the various facets of S.386 including the amendments, states that the bill allows investigations against H-1B frauds to be based on anonymous complaints, eliminates arbitrary deadlines on investigations and permits investigations for general non-compliance with LCA requirements, as opposed to simply for a wilful violation. It seeks to increase the penalties for LCA violations that have remained unchanged since 1990. Whistle-blower protection, which is already available, is also incorporated in the amendment. The fee proposed for LCA documentation will be used to fund the department of labour's (DOL's) administrative and investigative activities associated with H-1B programme. A few amendments in the bill, such as the 30 day internet posting requirement, could cause delays and challenges, states an immigration expert. Another counsel says: "Companies can depute their employees on a B-1 (business) visa to the US for a temporary period. The requirement was that the salary should be borne by the non-US employer. While a B-1 was getting tougher to obtain, it was an option available. The bill seeks to eliminate the 'B-1 in lieu of H-1B' option. We need to see how this will pan out." Court allows Gupta wedding at eco sensit.description: NAINITAL: The Uttarakhand high court on Tuesday said that the Chamoli district magistrate will be held accountable for compliance of the court’s order to minimize environmental damages caused due to high-profile weddings of Gupta family in Auli. The court also asked the Indian-born South African businessmen to deposit Rs 3 crore to be used to restore the area after events are over on June 23. A division bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan and Justice Alok Kumar Verma ordered the DM to ensure that the "measures suggested by the Uttarakhand State Pollution Control Board, the directives issued by the Joshimath Nagar Palika Parishad, and those issued by this Court both on June 17 and 18 are adhered to" by Ajay Gupta and the Noida-based event management firm. The court said that it is open to the DM to “take stringent action for such violations, including, if need be, by stopping the event itself”. The HC also added that failure on the part of Chamoli DM “to take action against them for any such violations may necessitate proceedings being initiated against him for non-compliance of the order”. Officials from Uttarakhand Pollution Control Board, through their counsel, submitted in the court that a team of two monitoring assistants (scientists) has been deputed at the venue. “The monitoring assistants shall also ensure that no firecrackers are used; and the orchestra/band, brought for the event, shall not be permitted to play music beyond the permitted decibel levels, prescribed for areas like Auli, and in any event not beyond 10 pm,” the court directed. Use of JCB machines has also been prohibited by the court. The bench directed the Uttarakhand State Pollution Control Board to prepare an assessment of the damage caused to the area and suggest “ameliorative measures required to be taken to restore the area”. In its order, the court remarked that while the venue of the event may not itself be a bugyal (meadow), it is not known what steps the state government has taken to ensure that the marriage celebrations do not affect the bugyal. Public transport facility crisis in hill.description: Uttarkashi/Dehradun: Home to the four shrines — Gangotri, Yamunotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath — of the Char Dham circuit, the Garhwal region of the hill state is currently witnessing a heavy influx of pilgrims due to the ongoing Yatra season. And as almost 80% of the public transport vehicles are pressed into service on the Char Dham route, lack of commuting options has left locals of the region in a lurch. The transport crisis comes despite 2,500 registered taxis plying in the Garhwal region. Speaking to TOI, Harikrishna Kanswal, Garhwal taxi union president, said, “It is rather difficult for the taxi drivers to manage their expenses within the lean earnings they make from transporting locals. The pilgrimage season helps the taxi drivers earn a decent living which is why taxi operators are keen on plying on the Char Dham Yatra route.” Among all the districts of the division, Uttarkashi, where the Gangotri and Yamunotri shrines are located, is the worst impacted as only 300 taxis are currently plying on the intra-city routes. “We have around 1450 taxis in the district but 1150 out of them are plying on the Char Dham Yatra route. The remaining 300 taxis are not sufficient to fulfill the transportation requirements of the district,” Arjun Bhandari, president, district taxi union, told TOI. Similar is the case with public buses in the district. “At present, 35 out of the total 62 public buses are operating on the Char Dham Yatra route and the remaining 27 are plying on other routes of Uttarkashi district. Due to this, we are not able to provide bus services in areas like Gorsali, Barsu and Bangaun. Also, we have not been able to provide bus services in Assi Ganga valley region and a few other routes due to lack of enough passengers and poor condition of roads,” Gajpal Rawat, president of Tehri Garhwal motor owners union, told TOI.  Locals say that this situation is not new. “It happens quite often. Most of the taxis which are the only mode of transport for many of us get involved in the yatra and we are stuck,” said Ajay Bisht, a resident of Pauri Garhwal district. When queried, Chakrapani Mishra, ARTO Uttarkashi, told TOI, “Difficult terrain has been among the major causes behind the transportation woes, especially in hilly areas. There is a need to look beyond traditional modes of transportation to check the issue.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Six years on, family members of those mi.description: Dehradun: Saurabh Bhatt, a resident of Kanpur, whose wife and nine-year-old daughter went missing during the 2013 Kedarnath floods, visits Uttarakhand every year, in the hope that he may get a trace of them. On the sixth anniversary of the tragedy on Sunday, he even put out advertisements in local dailies announcing a cash reward of Rs 5 lakh to anybody who can provide information regarding his family.“Losing someone to a natural death is obviously a big blow but not knowing what happened to your loved ones is even more excruciating. I have been to Uttarakhand 25 times since the tragedy and have tracked almost every village of the state trying to find my daughter and wife,” Bhatt told TOI over phone, the pain of not knowing what has happened to his family, evident in his voice. Similar is the story of Nitin Asati, a resident of Dantewada in Chhattisgarh. Seven of Asati’s family members, including his parents, had gone missing during the 2013 calamity but he still hopes that some miracle will bring them back to him. “I did all I could to trace my kin but did not meet with success. I understand that they might not have survived the devastating floods but I still haven’t given up hope,” he said. Amita Yadav, an Indore resident, also clings to similar hopes for her missing father. As per the initial official record of the state government, as many as 4000 people had gone missing in the Kedarnath disaster that took place between June 13 and 17 in 2013. However, the government later presumed the missing ones as dead. Since the tragedy, the state government has recovered skeletons of 699 bodies from the debris, among which identities of 29 bodies have been ascertained through DNA tests and other methods. Over 3000 still remain missing. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Devotees from India, abroad throng Kainc.description: NAINITAL: Thousands of devotees, including foreigners, congregated at the annual fair at the Kainchi Dham near Nainital, seat of the mystic Neem Karauri Baba on Saturday.  District police and administration made arrangements for the event which included several traffic diversions and security measures in a 10-kilometre radius of the shrine.  Devotees had walked for over 8 km as vehicles were not allowed near the temple to avoid traffic congestion. “We would walk even 20 km if we had to. Baba ji’s blessings are always there with us,” said Sandeep Shukla, a devotee from Lucknow.  Selena Bright, a resident of Phoenix, United States of America (USA), who was at the temple, said, “I am a believer and have faith in the saint and his healing powers. I will try to come again.”  Neem Karauri Baba, who passed away in 1973, had set up the temple in 1962. Tales of “miracles” performed by him still reverberate in the Kumaon hills. The word “Kainchi” (scissors) for the dham is used to describe two sharp “hairpin” bends of the roads.  Kainchi Dham had shot into the limelight after Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg, in an interaction with PM Modi at the Facebook headquarters in 2015, mentioned that he had visited an Indian temple on the suggestion of Apple founder Steve Jobs. The temple was later presumed to be Kainchi dham.  Jobs had visited Kainchi Dham Ashram in the 70s but didn’t find Neem Karauri Baba there.  The temple’s present structure was built gradually over the years after its inauguration on June 15, 1964. In 1962, the ascetic, who died on September 10, 1973, built a chabutara (platform). The current temple is based on that foundation, along the bank of Shipra river.  Popular fables recite that the saint left his home in 1958 when his youngest daughter was all of 11 years old. Total 108 temples dedicated to him are also built at several other places across the country and the world, including Lucknow and Texas, USA. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Power cuts follow rain, Doon worst hit.description: DEHRADUN: The Uttarakhand Power Corporation Limited (UPCL) helpline kept buzzing till late night on Monday when heavy rains had lashed the city. Power cuts were reported in many parts of town after Monday’s rains and electricity supply wasn’t properly restored till the next morning. Almost all major areas, including Cross Road, Dilaram Bazar, Karanpur, Rajpur, Raipur and Sahastradhara Road remained without power till Tuesday morning. UPCL officials said that strong winds had felled a number of trees, which damaged a total of 31 poles and created short-circuit in three transformers in Garhwal region. Dehradun was the most affected, with 18 of the damaged poles and all three damaged transformers being from the district. Ramesh Chauhan, a resident of Cross Road said, “Even after (power) supply was restored in our area by Tuesday morning, the voltage was so low that we couldn’t switch on any devices. Calls to the helpline went unanswered many times. Finally when the operator answered, they had no information on when the power would be restored or what had caused the outage.” Even though UPCL managing director BCK Mishra said that all the damages had been repaired and supply restored to normal, power supply was intermittent on Tuesday. Residents complained of frequent power cuts since morning. “In early morning, there were frequent power cuts. Even though the monsoon has not started yet, this is the state of preparedness. Imagine what will happen in July and August,” said Ashish Negi, a resident of Subhash Road. When asked about the discom’s preparedness for monsoon, Mishra said UPCL had made all necessary arrangements and was ready to restore power supply even in far-flung areas. “We have the men and material ready. We have also sent adequate supplies to all the distribution centres across the state and are ready to handle any challenge,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

10 choppers to make 50 sorties to ferry.description: Dehradun: Ten hired choppers would undertake over 50 sorties to fly over 150 selected guests coming from across the globe to the picturesque Auli where the grand weddings of the sons of Gupta brothers are being held at an altitude of over 12,000 feet in Chamoli district. The Indian-born South African business tycoons, who have been at the centre of a scandal due to their proximity with former South African president Jacob Zuma, are in Auli. The family has been overseeing the preparations of the grand wedding and welcoming the high-profile guests. On Monday, when the ceremonies of the weddings would begin in Auli, the Uttarakhand high court would also hear a PIL alleging environmental damages due to the lavish event. At the hotel, where royal tents have been erected in the open space, all the arrangements have been made for the guests, who would be flown from Sahastradhara helipad to Auli. “According to a tentative estimate, over Rs 2 crore would be spent on the chopper sorties,” said a source. Ajay Gupta’s son Surya Kant would tie the nuptial knot with Kritika, daughter of Suresh Singhal based in Delhi’s Rohini, and the ceremonies would be held between June 18 and June 22. In the second wedding, Atul Gupta’s son Shashank will marry Shivangni, daughter of Dubai-based Vishal Jalan, between June 20 and June 22. The high-profile guests will include Bollywood actors, business leaders, yoga guru Ramdev, chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat and a couple of state ministers. On Sunday, the Gupta family organized a grand feast for the local villagers who are invited to the main venue in Auli. “Over 150 guests would be staying in the hotel and in tents set up outside the hotel. All the arrangements have been completed,” said an executive associated with the firm managing the event. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttarakhand high court invites suggestio.description: NAINITAL: Uttarakhand high court has invited suggestions regarding shifting of its premises from Nainital. On Sunday, a link was posted on the high court’s website for the public to drop in their recommendations. The development comes after a practising advocate MC Kandpal wrote a letter to the chief justice mentioning the difficult topography of Nainital and the limited space of the town. “The high court doesn’t have proper parking space for its practising advocates and irregular parking often leads to traffic jams in the city,” the letter read. It also stated that the current location of the high court doesn’t provide any room for its expansion. Kandpal, in his letter, suggested the court to shift its operations to Hindustan Machine Tools factory premises in Ranibagh near Haldwani, a foothill town of Nainital. “In view of the increase in the number of litigations, it can be adjudged that soon there will be no space left for documentation inside the court, leave aside other things,” said a city resident, on condition of anonymity. TOI had reported earlier that Uttarakhand courts, including high court, had a total of 2,66,387 pending cases on December 31, 2018 registering an increase of 58% between 2014 and 2018. The pending criminal cases across courts registered a 72% increase while civil cases registered a 19% growth during the period. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

9th century Narasimha statue unearthed i.description: PITHORAGARH: The sleepy village of Mayal along the banks of the Ramganga river in Berinag tehsil of Pithoragarh district was abuzz with excitement when locals stumbled upon an ancient idol of Narasimha (an avatar of Vishnu) during the construction of a dharamshala a few days ago. Pankaj Karki, a local resident, told TOI, “The village currently has only a small temple of goddess Durga. The villagers had recently decided to construct a dharamshala on the temple premises. During the construction work, we unearthed two statues — one of Narasimha while the other is not recognisable.” He added that “following the discovery, we sent photographs of the statues to the local Archeological Survey of India (ASI) officer for further information.” Chandra Singh Chauhan, in-charge of ASI at Almora, said, “We have seen the photographs and believe that the statues are made of granite and date to the 9th century, when granite was primarily used for sculpting. An ASI team will soon visit Malay village to study the statues. We would also explore if there was an older temple in that area.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Scuffle between tourists and civic worke.description: Mussoorie: A fight between tourists and workers of Mussoorie Municipal Council (MMC) over entry into the Mall Road led to the arrest of six people, including three MMC workers. However, soon after the arrest of their colleagues, agitated MMC workers went on strike and opened the barriers on Mall Road resulting in confusion and chaos on the Mall. The incident took place on Monday afternoon when three tourists from Meerut got into a fight with MMC workers posted at the barrier of Mall Road at Picture Palace over the entry of their vehicle into the area. The matter escalated to the extent that MMC workers along with locals started beating up the tourists, who the MMC workers alleged were under the influence of alcohol. Police initially arrested the tourists but later released them after a compromise was reached between both the parties. However, matters escalated when the police arrested three MMC workers and three other locals on charges of beating up the tourists. Soon after this, president of MMC workers’ union Mahavir Rana along with a large number of workers reached the police station and shouted slogans against the police. Rana said, “MMC workers were only doing their duty and their arrest is unjustified. The MMC workers will go on an indefinite strike.” Mussoorie station house officer (SHO) Bhawna Kainthola when queried about the issue, said that instead of beating the tourists, the MMC workers should have filed a complaint. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Six years after tragedy: A lot achieved,.description: DEHRADUN: On June 16 2013, the Kedar Valley was devastated by flash floods which left over 4,000 dead or missing. Six years down the line, a lot has been achieved in form of reconstruction and infrastructure. However, a lot still remains to be done as over 3,500 dead are yet to be traced, properly planned chopper services remain a challenge, and accommodating high number of pilgrims and facilities remain a concern for the authorities. Experts have also raised concern over the large-scale construction work in the valley and have termed it as an effort to “develop a concrete jungle” at Kedarnath. For the reconstruction work at Kedarnath, Rs 300 crore has already been used. Houses for 40 priests have been constructed and the work is on to complete the houses for 73 others. Retaining wall and banks have been constructed along Mandakini and Saraswati rivers. Earlier, the approach road to the temple was merely six to seven feet wide but it has now been increased to 50 feet. A grand entrance plaza greets the pilgrims who take the 50-feet-wide and 278-metre-long approach road to reach the shrine.The temple platform area had been increased from 27,000sqft to 41,000sqft. A safety wall has also been constructed behind the shrine. Rudraprayag district magistrate Mangesh Ghildiyal, who has been monitoring the development works, said, “It is because of the hard work put in by the entire team that the number of devotees is on the rise with the each passing year. We are ensuring better facilities and medical attention to pilgrims coming from different parts of the country.”He added that there are some sectors that still need attention. “We need more toilets as number of pilgrims is increasing. Accommodation facilities also need to be improved,” he said. Meanwhile, Congress MLA from Kedarnath Manoj Rawat said that a lot more needs to be done. “I fail to understand why the BJP government is yet to come up with a proper policy for helicopter services on Kedarnath route. People are struggling to get ticket, there is no proper system, online tickets are always booked and there is a state of utmost confusion here. This year, the chopper services started a week after the yatra began,” he said. He added that the damage done to fabricated huts by heavy snowfall has “compounded the miseries of the pilgrims. “Under freezing conditions, people are being made to stay in tents.” He added that more efforts were required to find the dead. “So many people come in search for their loved ones. Planned campaigns are required to give them closure.” Hridayesh Joshi, who has covered the tragedy extensively as a mediaperson and also written a book on it, said, “For me, the biggest concern is the move to develop the area as a concrete jungle. Do we require this sort of construction at Kedarnath? How much good is it doing to the ecology?” He added, “The excessive use of helicopters and heavy machines is also not good for the environment.” For the past few years, the state government has also been aiming to set up three Doppler radars in the state for accurate weather forecast in order to be better equipped to handle flash floods like situations.  On the progress on that front, Bikram Singh, regional met director, said, “We are optimistic of setting up the radar at Mukteshwar in July and at Surkanda in the next two months.” He added that the third radar at Pithoragarh would also be installed within this year. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Almora records negative population growt.description: HARIDWAR: Migration from Almora has outpaced the population growth in the district, revealed a report unveiled at the second annual general meeting of state's Rural and Migration commission on Monday, which was attended by chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat. The report brings out the migration menace of the district to the fore pointing out that Almora witnessed a negative population growth (-1.64%) during 2001-2011. The summary of the report, a copy of which is with TOI, reads, “In the last ten years, a total of 53, 611 persons from 1022 gram panchayats have migrated on a semi-permanent basis, though they come to their homes in the villages from time to time and have not migrated permanently.” The report further reveals that the total rural population of the district dipped by 4.20% during the period. The report cited the lack of agricultural lands in the district as one of the major reasons behind the migration. Notably, only 7-to-8 percent of the district’s land area is fit for agriculture. Meanwhile, taking cognizance of the issue of migration, especially from hilly areas, CM Rawat tasked the commission to analyse the migration patterns in Tehri and Pithoragarh as well. Photos: Court bans chopper sorties at Gu.description: NAINITAL: Uttarakhand high court (HC) while hearing a public interest litigation (PIL) regarding the high-profile wedding of South Africa’s Gupta family at Auli in the Garhwal Himalayas, prevented operating of helicopter services and construction of helipad at the venue. The order, issued by the division bench of chief justice Ramesh Ranganathan and justice Alok Kumar Verma, said, “If as contended on behalf of the petitioner, there is no helipad at Auli, and prior to this event, helicopter services were not provided to the said place, the private respondents shall neither construct a helipad nor extend helicopter services to such places as that would have an adverse impact on the environment.” The judges however allowed the family “to use the nearest helipad after obtaining the requisite permission from the authorities concerned.” The construction site in Auli where the wedding will be heldEarlier, during deliberations, the judges came down heavily on the state government saying that the first responsibility of the government is the state and not 'some rich businessman from South Africa'. They also directed the state government to ensure that “these mindless pursuits of holding large-scale marriage celebrations at exotic locations, and at such places where such mega-events have never been conducted earlier, do not result in irreparable environmental degradation of the said area.” The bench while hearing the petition also added that Uttarakhand is the only state which will ecologically save the country. "We will not permit you to destroy Uttarakhand," the bench said. The judges also questioned the reason for the choice of venue and asked if there was not anywhere else to host the wedding considering that “these people reside in South Africa and Dubai.” "Once the damage is caused, it will be irreversible," said the bench. The judges also questioned the reason for the choice of venue and asked if there was not anywhere else to host the weddingThe court also directed the state pollution control board to monitor the events of the wedding constantly till the conclusion of the functions in order to check “from all angles the damage to environment and ecology of the area.” The court had initially asked for a security amount of Rs 5 crore to be deposited but the counsel for the Gupta brothers requested to reduce the amount to Rs 2 crore after which the court said that the final amount will be decided at the next hearing on Tuesday when an assessment of the likely environmental damage caused due to the wedding celebrations is submitted by the state pollution control board. While passing the order, the court noted that calling off the marriage at this stage may result in "irreparable injury" to the family. "While it is debatable whether the authorities are justified in granting such permissions, interdiction by this court at this belated stage when the events are scheduled to commence today i.e. 17.06.2019, may result in the marriage being called off, causing irreparable injury to families concerned. While that, by itself, may not justify the private respondents being permitted to damage the sensitive ecology of the upper Himalayas, where Auli is situated, the least that must be done is to minimize any adverse effect which this large-scale event may have on the fragile ecosystem at Auli," said the court. The judges further asked the state government to clarify by Tuesday whether the venue of the marriage is a bugyal (meadow) in order to determine whether it would be covered by an order of a division bench of the HC last year. The bench had prohibited camping activities in all bugyals across the state. The petitioner, Rakshit Joshi, a resident of Kashipur in Udham Singh Nagar district had in his petition stated that “tents were being set up in the eco-sensitive region, and such a high-profile wedding will generate tonnes of garbage causing much damage to the environment.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Almora rape accused sent to 14-day judic.description: DEHRADUN: Three men accused of raping a 13-year-old Dalit girl were produced in court and were later sent to a 14-day judicial custody on Saturday. Talking to TOI, circle officer Almora, Kamal Ram Arya said that the accused identified as Mahendra Kumar, Pankaj Arya and Rajan Ram were arrested from their residences on Friday. “Police teams will be sent to arrest one more accused who works outstation,” Arya said. A thirteen-year-old Dalit girl from Almora was raped by five men including two brothers, a middle aged man and a teenager, for over a year. The matter came to light when the minor victim delivered a still born baby in government district women hospital on Monday. Notably, one of the accused in the case, Chandan Ram, 48, committed suicide by consuming poison on Thursday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Medical services hit in Dehradun as doct.description: Dehradun: Healthcare service were affected across the city on Monday as private doctors shut their Out-Patient Departments (OPDs) and stayed away from attending patients in response to the nationwide strike called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) in support of the medicos agitating in West Bengal. While many hospitals cancelled surgeries, others refused to treat regular patients, forcing the district government hospitals to increase their OPD timings to cater to the influx of patients. The private hospitals had decided to keep their OPDs shut from Monday 6 am till Tuesday 6 am. City-based Shri Mahant Indiresh Hospital (SMIH) however didn’t participate in the strike. “Keeping the convenience of patients in mind, we decided not to participate in the strike. All emergency and OPD services ran as usual at our hospital,” said Bhupendra Raturi, PRO, SMIH. Doctors at government hospitals in the city also observed a partial strike. At Government Doon Medical College Hospital (GDMCH), the doctors started OPD at 10 am against the regular timing of 8 am. “Many doctors avoided OPD from 8 am to 10 am on Monday, but a few opted not to take part in the strike. Seeing the heavy influx of patients, I extended the OPD timings. The patients were treated till 3 pm,” said Dr KK Tamta, chief medical superintendent, GDMCH. Meanwhile, the strike caught many patients by surprise. “My mother was complaining of joint pain since Saturday night. I couldn’t take her to a doctor on Sunday as the clinics were closed. I took her to Max Hospital initially, but the OPD was closed. Next day, I also visited private orthopaedics clinics, but they, too, were on strike,” said Vinay Singh, who works at a security agency. The IMA had announced withdrawal of non-essential medical services for 24 hours in support of the striking junior doctors in West Bengal. Speaking to TOI, IMA’s state president Dr BS Judge said that the safety of doctors has been a matter of great concern and it needs to be addressed on priority. “A proper law against assault on doctors has been our long-standing demand. This time, the government must ensure that some strong legal action is taken against all the accused who have hit the doctors in West Bengal,” he added.
